comments:
*** With Eclipse 3.0.2 it was fine. ***

While using "EPIC Testing: 0.3.10" (http://e-p-i-c.sf.net/updates/testing). 

Details:
=======

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView.findFrame
(LaunchView.java:451)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView.access$5
(LaunchView.java:443)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView$3.run
(LaunchView.java:417)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

eclipse.buildId=I20050401-1645
java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

This indicates a debug model implementation is not conforming to the spec 
required for IThread.getBreakpoints(). It is not allowed to return null.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 89761 ***
